intro: Lithospermum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf lithosperm, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy purple or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Its roots contain compounds that have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties. The plant is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a hardy and adaptable species.
